decks.notes: The deck is focused on generating mana quickly through rituals and medallions to build up to a massive storm count. By casting multiple spells in a turn, the player can trigger cards like Grapeshot or Artist's Talent for a game-winning combo. The deck incorporates card draw and deck manipulation to find the necessary pieces to execute the combo. Additionally, Ral, Monsoon Mage provides extra value by copying or recurring key spells. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a high storm count and finish them off in one explosive turn.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of colorless mana in order to cast powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck also utilizes disruptive creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, along with removal spells like Dismember and Kozilek's Command to control the game. With access to powerful colorless planeswalkers like Ugin, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its threats and disruption while utilizing its mana advantage to gain a strategic edge.

This deck focuses on aggressive play combined with disruptive elements to control the opponent's game plan. By utilizing quick creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, as well as powerful removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to apply pressure while thwarting the opponent's strategy. Additionally, cards like Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional disruption and control options, allowing the deck to effectively disrupt the opponent's plays and push for a quick victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board and protect its own threats. The key strategy is to establish a board presence quickly and disrupt the opponent's resources through targeted removal and hand disruption spells. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp, while also having a variety of ways to deal with different types of threats.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and using cards like Mox Opal to accelerate mana production. By sacrificing artifacts with cards like Arcbound Ravager and Claws of Gix, the player can pump up their creatures and deal big damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifact cards like Mishra's Bauble and Pinnacle Emissary. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy that takes advantage of the synergy between artifact creatures and sacrifice effects.

This combo deck aims to quickly assemble the pieces needed to generate a large amount of mana and draw through the deck using Song of Creation. Emry, Lurker of the Loch is used to recur artifacts and Mox Opal to ramp. Jace, Wielder of Mysteries is the win condition, allowing the player to win the game if they draw through their entire deck. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Tormod's Crypt and Urza's Saga to slow down the opponent while setting up the combo. Overall, the key strategy is to set up the combo quickly and efficiently to win the game.

This deck revolves around the key synergy between Splinter Twin and Deceiver Exarch, allowing you to create infinite token copies of Deceiver Exarch to attack and win the game quickly. The deck also includes elements of control and disruption with cards like Force of Negation and Endurance to protect your combo. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Bloodbraid Marauder and Architects of Will for card advantage and Incubation / Incongruity for flexibility in finding combo pieces. The goal is to assemble the combo while controlling the board to secure victory.

This UW Control deck focuses on stalling the opponent's threats with removal spells and counterspells while maintaining card advantage through card draw effects like Opt, Telling Time, and Meticulous Archive. It also utilizes planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler for additional control and card advantage. The deck includes a few win conditions such as Hall of Storm Giants and Monumental Henge while also having access to Terminus for board wipes. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion offers additional value and synergy with the deck's creature base.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a high volume of artifacts on the board and use cards like Arcbound Ravager and Weapons Manufacturing to boost their power and quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble to generate card advantage and maintain board presence. The inclusion of cards like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt provide some control elements, while the Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer offer additional threats to close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to aggressively pressure the opponent and win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard recursion and card advantage to bring out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones early in the game, while disrupting opponents' plans with cards like Thoughtseize and Spell Pierce. By combining the reanimation aspect with card draw and control elements, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its powerful creatures and disrupt their strategies, ultimately leading to a quick and decisive victory.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Desperate Ritual, Pyretic Ritual, and Ruby Medallion. It also uses cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Wrenn's Resolve to create a combo that can deal significant damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck utilizes cards like Glimpse the Impossible and Reckless Impulse to dig for key combo pieces and Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard. The goal is to create a storm of spells that can overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck is focused on using Eldrazi creatures to ramp up mana quickly, paired with control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ugin, Eye of the Storms provide powerful threats while spells like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command can clear the opponent's board. The deck also utilizes cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to ramp up mana even further. By casting powerful Eldrazi creatures early in the game, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and control the game until victory.

This deck focuses on using Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to generate immense value and overwhelm opponents quickly. By utilizing lands with powerful effects like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field, the deck can ramp up mana quickly and consistently. The main win conditions include assembling multiple Titan triggers to search for key lands like Vesuva or Crumbling Vestige, setting up powerful Scapeshift plays, and utilizing Green Sun's Zenith to find key creatures like Arboreal Grazer. The deck aims to create explosive turns and outpace opponents with its combo potential and land synergy.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It aims to flood the board with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, while using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and finish off the opponent. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional power and resilience, while cards like Arena of Glory and Elegant Parlor help to support the aggressive game plan. The deck's goal is to apply constant pressure and end the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck revolves around assembling specific pieces to create a powerful combo that can quickly win the game. It focuses on utilizing cards like Serum Powder, Devourer of Destiny, and Plunge into Darkness to set up key pieces and combo off. Cards like Thud and Spoils of the Vault are critical for pulling off the combo, while Pact of Negation helps protect it. The deck also includes ramp and mana fixing to ensure the combo can be executed efficiently. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and surprise the opponent with a game-winning play.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also includes cards like Solitude and Prismatic Ending for removal and disruption. The deck aims to combo off and win the game quickly by reanimating big threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Teferi, Time Raveler and Thoughtseize provide additional control and disruption, while cards like Psychic Frog offer card advantage. Overall, the deck combines reanimation and instant spells to create a powerful combo strategy.
